item.title: About
item.content:encoded:
'All in a row' was born from a single image of shoes in a line at the end of a bed. It has now grown into a platform that talks about what is good, new and exciting in New Zealand — exploring Music, Fashion, Art and People through images. Life is too short to be negative, only positive.

It started with a young girl, ten years old to be precise and has now been growing for the past 11 years. Over this period we have had collaborators, guest writers, crazy interviews and the opportunity to meet some of the most wonderful people New Zealand and the wider world has to offer.

Stay tuned for more

New Website upgrades are in the works, so keep an eye out.

Words and Imagery by Madeleine Brighouse-Mayo

Unless otherwise said.

item.title: Lela Jacobs AW15
item.content:encoded:
I love the raw and deconstructedness of Lela Jacobs winter collection. All the layers and printed words on her pieces are strange and wonderful. So here are some of my favourite piece of her art. (I hope to one day own some, if I'm very very lucky!)

photos by James Black

item.title: Rookie year book two...
item.content:encoded:
After reading the first Rookie Year Book I just had to read the second!   Just like the first this one was filled with interesting interviews and stories from people who felt like they didn't fit into school or society.  Here are some photos from the Rookie Year Book Two.  Check out Tavi Gevinson's website Rookiemag.com (she's the person who started all this and the editor of all the Rookie Year Books).   I'm looking forward to Year Book THREE.

photos taken FujiFilm X-M1

item.title: Armageddon
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1165.0"] i'm Princess Mononoke, Theo is a jawa, Riley is the 12th Doctor (Peter Capaldi) [/caption]

Armageddon this year was so much fun! The photo above is of me and my brothers dressed and ready for Armageddon, i look so unhappy but the truth is I'm just so excited i can't contain it. here are photos from Saturday of people and things i loved while there. if you didn't go this year you must go next year for it was full of geekiness, gamers and cosplay.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1184.0"] Laura Wotton (i know her as Molly) dressed as Lara Croft [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1121.0"] Back to the future, a DeLorean, my dads dream car. [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="949.0"] Izzy Brown dressed as Kiki from Kiki's delivery service [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1058.0"] Richard Kuoch at his stall, Podgy Panda check out his art its really cool. item.title: Stolen Girlfriends Club AW15
item.content:encoded:
Only Stolen Girlfriends Club could get so many people to turn up to a cold speedway and have a great time. We were all handed plastic bag raincoats (just in case of rain) and were seated on concrete benches as the models walked 400 metres down western springs speed way. I'm trying to do the maths in my head of how many hours of babysitting I'll need to do so I can get everything in the collection! (I don't think I'll be able to manage it). So here are my favourite picks from their winter collection

item.title: Rookie year book one...
item.content:encoded: i found out about Tavi Gevinson and Rookie, when i was in Real Groovy (a cool record store). i had found the "Rookie Year Book One" and i fell in love with it. Tavi Gevinson started the blog called Rookiemag.com and now she has published this book. the book is filled with stories from people who never felt they fitted in at school or in life and how they dealt with it. that is not all that is in there, it is also filled with interviews with awesome people like Joss Whedon (creator of some of the best tv shows ever - Firefly, Buffy and he also directed Cabin in The Woods plus The Avengers). if you can't get hold of this book try the library or her amazing website.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: MKTO at pepsi party house
item.content:encoded:
Spent a great night at the Pepsi party house after interviewing MKTO earlier in the day for Pepsi. There were no parents, no noise control and a whole heap of fun. It was great to see MKTO play and loved it with all the animal masks! Looking forward to the next party later in the year... hopefully I will get to go!

Photos by Toby Lyons

item.title: VNZMA 2014
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Broods  performing 'Bridges' [/caption]

It was such an honour to go to the Vodafone New Zealand Music Awards last night, thank you to the Localist for making it possible for me to attend. I was proud to see Lorde win 6 tuis and The Naked and Famous took some awards home too. Still crying inside because Clap Clap Riot didn't win best rock album, but hey next year for sure. Here are some photos i took from the Red Carpet and during the night.

item.title: Festival One street style
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="596.0"] This is Milo, he is the coolest kid! Loving his tee "Long Hair Don't Care" homemade. [/caption]

I met some of the coolest people over the weekend! And some agreed to let me take their photo, so here are some of the street style at Festival One 2015.

Jassher Clayton and Tiffany Ross from Late Night Poets. Jassher wearing Maaike squiggle with I Love Ugly Sunnies and Tiffany wearing Maaike Scope Singlet with the Compound Dress.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Samara wearing a Recycle Boutique  Skirt with a Federation  top, sunnies off Ebay, an opshop bag and sandals from Glassons  [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Lily Futyus wearing an Opshop dress, $2 dollar shop sunnies and Vans . [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1058.0"] Flora Dryburgh is wearing a skirt from her mother with a Factorie top (it was on sale!) Portmans sunnies and an amazing hat from her stepmother, plus $10 jandals from the Number One Shoes   [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Tiffany Ross from Late Night Poets  wearing the Maaike   Perception Jacket [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Stephen Hart wearing an AS Colour stranded Tee with a Hallensteins necklace, shoes from Number One Shoes and Handmade shorts by a lady in a local church in Nepal! [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Me looking not very happy (cos the sun was in my eyes) I'm lucky enough to be wearing a Zac Fay tee from Strange Love with Kowtow Shorts, Nom*D socks and my beloved converse, plus heart shaped sunnies from a $2 dollar shop.  [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Deleesha Cains wearing a Hillsong, the colour sisterhood tee , an Opshop dress, Chuck Taylors and a necklace she made herself. [/caption]

item.title: Stolen Girlfriends Club have a new store...
item.content:encoded:
Stolen Girlfriends Club have a new store, it's at 20 Nuffeild Street in Newmarket. Have you been to see it yet coz if you haven't then you should!?

Go in and drooled over all the clothes and jewellery, try clothes on, have a chat and hang. I absolutely love the Dress below!! It would the amazing for a Ball...
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Kimonos
item.content:encoded:
So there is this amazing secret that i have to share with you! While i was with some friends i came across this old warehouse building called the 'Asia Gallery, seller of kimonos and vintage fabrics'. This shop was filled with racks and racks of vintage kimonos all in wonderful bright vibrant colours, most only costed $25 some even $5. If your ever near Onehunga go and check this place out. It's at 67 Maurice Road Penrose Auckland 1061. These photos are of Kimonos that I've collected from this wondrous emporium.  

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Vintage Silk Kimono (this isn't my kimono but my friend brought it with me) [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Vintage Cotten Kimono (I use this one as a dressing gown) [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Vintage Cotton Kimono (This was my christmas kimono, i wore it on christmas day) [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Vintage Silk Kimono (This is a child's sized kimono) [/caption]
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: RUBY backstage
item.content:encoded: After recovering from the fantastic Stolen show the night before, i made my way to the top of a car parking building off K Road. RUBY had transformed it into a pink paradise ready for a runway show! They also had a secret space hidden from view where you could buy the clothes from the runway - clever! I got to help out the producer - and i may have got a few backstage shots while I was doing it.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Marr Factory: Nom*D
item.content:encoded: Nom*D showed at Marr Factory the other night at Golden Dawn-taven of power and here are my favourite shots from the night. i expeclly love the iconic tees of 'Nico' and 'Amy Winehouse'. All clothes are available online and in stores.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Marr Factory: Zambesi
item.content:encoded: Had a great night at Marr Factory seeing the Zambesi show.  Got to see the cool kids bruno and Lylah walking! here are my favourite shots, all available in store or online.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Vans X Eley Kishimoto
item.content:encoded:
Eley Kishimoto and Vans have teamed up and made this amazing collaboration. It was just meant to be - too perfect together!  Eley Kishimoto is a fashion and design company based in London.

All my shots are with the 'Flash' print as it is my all time favourite.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Stolen Girlfriends Club: Backstage NZFW15
item.content:encoded: This year i got to work as a production assistant on the Stolen Girlfriends Club show at NZFW. The show was held at the amazing St James Theatre in town. Celebrating their tenth anniversary, Stolen Girlfriends Club definitely made the most of it! the show was BIG, loud and awesome with confetti canons, a model jumping off stage during the show and the afterparty (that went till 4am). here are some shots i got in between running around and helping out. oh and my claim to fame is that i ran the runway music during the show, does that mean i can play at laneways now?
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Nom*d NZFW15
item.content:encoded: So blessed to have gone to the Nom*D show at NZFW 2015. I always love the layering, and the iconic prints that Nom*D  does so well and this show was no exception. Here are some of my favourite shots from the show. (Loved the Sam Hunt soundtrack)
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Zambesi
item.content:encoded: it was a real was a thrill to see Zambesi w2016! i was so pleased with the shots I got of the show -  I loved the knitwear and the signature print. always an incredible highlight to see a Zambesi show in the flesh - and an amazing way to end the week.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: RUBY NZFW15
item.content:encoded: And here are the runway shots I managed to get while working backstage at the RUBY s2015 show at NZFW.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: A.O.K
item.content:encoded: the AOK show had three of my favourite clothing designers in the world walk down the runway. Jimmy D, Jason Lingard and Lela Jacobs were all on one runway, for one show making me very happy! All the layered, black, drape-y goodness.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: The Caker
item.content:encoded: Jordan Rodel launched her new book The Caker from Beatnik in a space on K Road recently. The cakes were yummy as. and the space was just amazing. and now i am in love with raglan coconut yoghurt which featured with plum, lime and coconut cake - which was my absolute favourite. I'm off to do some baking now...
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Mac DeMarco
item.content:encoded: Saw Mac DeMaroco play at the Kings Arms Tavern a few weeks ago, such a fantastic gig! So glad he performed "Rock and Roll Night Club". Here are a few shots i managed to get while in the mosh pit.

item.title: Death Cab For Cutie
item.content:encoded: I believe that my mum and i can now die happy! I still can't really believe that we saw Death Cab For Cutie at the Saint James, i have loved them since i was small and my mother forced us to listen to them. These shots don't do the concert justice but i hope they will give you an idea. Next week is Violent Femmes!

What a night! What a great way for the St James Theatre to close, with the last concert being by the Violent Femmes. Me and my Girl Nina had a fantastic night. Another dream has been fufilled!

After months I'm finally able to present Veronica, the first in my series of portraits. I thought a Q & A wouldn't capture a person as well as i would like, so I asked the hard question "What song would best represent who you are, your personality, your wants your dreams, your beliefs?"

Captured and Styled by me with help thanks to Lonely, Meadowlark Jewellery, Underground Sundae, The Others agency and Kingsize Studios

item.title: Annabel
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Jarrad Godman Nuke dress  with Jimmy D Bruise Pristine Jacket [/caption]

Everyone needs a punk feminist to look up too, and Annabel is that for so many people! (Annabel is part of the band Miss June) My inner sixteen-year-old self-was jumping for joy when she agreed to be part of this project. It's not often one gets to hang and shoot one of their idols (shhh don't tell her tho, I'm trying to play it cool). 
The song that is Annabel, that best represents who she is as a person, and her ideas and beliefs are is ...

This is my final collection of portraits for this series of people. Thank you to everyone who took part in helping me create these images! Kingsize Studios, Meadowlark, Taylor, Underground Sundae, Jimmy D, Maakie, The Others Agency, Jojo Ross and Jarrad Godman.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Jimmy D Dress Pineal Eye and VPL Purple Neo Insertion Bra  with Underground Sundae Pincer Hoops & Clamp Choker [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Jimmy D Sonic Hoody [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Meadowlark Pentagram earrings [/caption]
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Nina
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Taylor Undone Tunic  with Underground Sundae LOBSTER HOOPS  And Lonely Edie Bikini [/caption]

On the 10th of April 2012 I was shooting with Black magazine in King size Studios (where these images were taken in fact!), when the coolest kid turned up wearing her hair in plaits and a Nom D tee. We were both too intimidated by each other that we didn't dare go over and meet. We were both 14 at the time. Fast forward 2 years to when we started chatting online, not knowing we had kinda met in the past. Now, this cool kid who still wears plaits in her hair is one of my closest friends! Thanks, my little Galfling 

Nina's pick of song is below and I feel that it definitely represents her!

Check her out @nina.vanlier

Special Thanks to, Taylor, Meadowlark, Underground Sundae, Jimmy D, Lonely, Kingsize Studios and Jarrad Godman

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Jimmy D Cursed Tee ,  Underground Sundae MILK BOTTLE HEART EARRING  with Jarrad Godman Dress [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Jimmy D BRUISE PRISTINE Jacket with Taylor Undone Tunic and Underground Sundae LOBSTER HOOPS [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Jimmy D The Sound of Change Dress [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Karen Walker Lady Hellkats biker Jacket (Nina's own Jacket) with Meadowlark Taboo hoop earrings [/caption]

item.title: What I Wore Day 2 of NZFW 2017
item.content:encoded:
Holy sh!t look at these pants!!!!!!!
I met Nicola when I modelled for her awhile ago. That's when I fell for her custom denim! 
She was so generous when I asked if I could wear them during fashion week. 
One day I'll get her to make me a pair of my own.
So for this outfit, I am pretty much head to toe in Levi's, White Levi's top and custom painted Levi's. Classic stacked Docs, and my favourite vintage leather jacket that I got from trade me, (I think I paid $25 for it, madness). Accompanied with Meadowlark's beautifully crafted metal and stones.

Photos thanks to the talented Amazir Aknine

Hair thanks to Dave Weaver at Stephen Marr

item.title: What I Wore Day 1 of NZFW 2017
item.content:encoded:
Now please understand this is not me going - look what I have and who I'm wearing - because this is not. This is acknowledging the beautiful, craft and quality of these NZ designers. I'm fortunate to be able to borrow some items from friends/mum/designers. 

As it was Zambesi last night, I stole some of my mum's vintage Zambesi pieces that she had hidden away with a beautiful set of Meadowlark rings, my classic jeans and Dr Martens. Ok, cool that's done. I hope that wasn't showie-offie cos I hate doing that. I only want to pass on my love for these designers onto you. 

Photos thanks to the Talented Amazir Aknine

Hair thanks to Dave Weaver at Stephen Marr
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

Federation is always fun

item.title: Lela Jacobs AW18
item.content:encoded:
Held inside the Silos down in Auckland's Viaduct, with live musicians, Lela always leaves you feeling light and ethereal.
Her show was easily one of my highlights of the week.

Here are my favourite pieces from this collection.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Jimmy D SS18
item.content:encoded:
I have so much love for James and what he does! How he can create a garment that looks amazing on a young person and look equally if not better on an older person of a different body shape. It's very common for mum and me to argue over who gets to wear a Jimmy D piece.

Katia and Maurice Krafft inspired this collection. They were a couple who were volcanologists who died in a pyroclastic flow on Mount Unzen, in Japan, on June 3, 1991.

Here are my favourite pieces from the collection. I'm going to be very broke soon, as I need every garment in this collection, especially the Silver jacket!
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

Makeup By MAC Cosmetics
Hair By Colleen

item.content:encoded:
The first show of the day was Jimmy D so of course, I wore my favourite Jimmy D pieces. The MAGIC CITY dress James made for my ball and the B*WITCHED crop top! I was so lucky to be able to wear a large lock necklace from Meadowlark. With my classic stacked Docs, a vintage Levi's leather fringed jacket from Trademe, paid like $25 for it.

Photos thanks to Gabrielle Stoddard

item.title: What I Wore Day 4
item.content:encoded:
My last outfit for this year's Fashion Week. Trashy old jeans ($1 in junk shop) My Dr Martens cos what else? Plus my vintage Wrangler leopard print coat (Can you guess where I got from?...Trade me). With a classic plain white tee with this beautiful Lock Choker from Meadowlark, combined with my own meadowlark pieces but I think I need to get some more fingers.

item.title: Jason Lingard AW18
item.content:encoded: It is hard for me to describe Jason's show (mainly cos I'm terrible with words). Jason had dancers come down the runway, slowly moving to the music in an almost alien like way. I wish you were there to see it cos my photos don't do the show justice.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: The Jungle Giants
item.content:encoded:
What a joy it was just to stand on the sideline and see the love and joy pouring out from this act! I had the immense pleasure of shooting one of my favourite Aussie bands, The Jungle Giants while they performed their new album 'Quiet Ferocity'. It was about time that they came over the water to play here.
If you haven't heard The Jungle Giants tunes, you need to. You can't help but bob your head and tap your feet to their groovy beats, my go-to for happy vibes.

item.title: NZ Musician Presents...
item.content:encoded:
This gig was a lot of firsts. My first time seeing all these bands perform live. My first time properly meeting Iris G after years of catching each other’s eye at gigs and only talking over social media. Iris G won last years Smokefree Rockquest's solo-duo. I can’t wait to see the places she will go, and hopefully, I’ll get to shoot them! 
I was very moved by Being's performance. Having heard so much about Jasmine Balmer's mesmerising sound from friends, I was so excited to hear Being Perform for the first time. Another artist that will be going places. 
To be honest, I’d never heard of BEACHWARE until seeing them. But I fell in love with their summer like feel; they reminded me of late nights on the beach and surfing. 

So here are my pics from a Wednesday night gig at The Wine Cellar, presented by NZMusicions.co.nz
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Juliette Hogan X Audi
item.content:encoded:
To celebrate Juliette Hogan and Audis partnership, Juliette Hogan put on an installation of her newest collection. Beautiful jumpers and knitwear combined with delicate lace patterns and burnt reds. As always simple elegant and beautiful.

Here are my pictures of my favourite pieces...

item.title: Company of Strangers Nails
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] JoJo Ross:  Surrealism Jacket and Daydream Rib Top .  [/caption]

I’m a sucker for anything music related, so when Company of Strangers brought out their new nail collection named after songs and artist they listen too in the store, I just had to try it! With inspiration from Bowie, to Nirvana, The Cult and others. So I decided to do a little shoot with model Cait from The Others Agency and Beverly Lim on Make-up! 
My favourite shade would have to be Major Tom inspired by Bowie.
The Coverage of these polishes are fantastic; they are so pigmented and have a great long wear life. 

So here are some shots of my favourite shades......

With Special Thanks to Underground Sundae, JoJo Ross, The Other Agency, Beverly Lim and Company Of Strangers. 

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Nail Colour: The Cult , Underground Sundae: Clamp Charm Necklace [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Nail Colour: Dancing Barefoot , Underground Sundae:  Grit and Pearls Ring and Filigree Rings .  [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Nail Colour: Major Tom , Company of Strangers: Soul Survivor Ring , Underground Sundae: Clamp Bracelet.   [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Nail Colour: Teen Spirit   [/caption]
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Seamless Presents...
item.content:encoded: I went to The Turning Fork the other night to see a Seamless gig. I went having seen and heard Openside and Altered Blondes in the past. But it was my first time hearing Foley, and I fell in love! I've been playing their new single 'Settle' on repeat! I hadn't seen, Abdul Kay before either and I loved him! He was great with the crowd and very funny, I loved his set. Check out his new single. As for Altered Blondes, it's always loud and grungy just how I like it! And for Openside, just the way they can amp a crowd up and have them all singing every lyric to there songs! The passion that all these bands have, I can't wait to see the places they all will go!
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Neil Finn & APO
item.content:encoded:
What a way to finish the week! 
I got a call on Thursday, and a day later I'm in the photographer's pit, shooting Neil Finn down at Auckland's Silos! 
Neil Finn was performing as part of The Auckland Arts Festival which started on the 8th and will continue until the 25th of March. 

Neil Finn was accompanied by Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra, and the combination could not have been more breathtaking. They performed Neil's newest album 'Out of Silence' which many if not most of the Orchestra performed on. 

Mum was super jealous when I told her who I was shooting!
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

I first heard King Krule's ‘Easy Easy’ at a fashion show back in 2014; I was hooked!

WOW! Just Wow! 
Emily King has been a favourite artist of mine for awhile, and it was just so epic to see her live finally. 
Emily's on-stage presence is a thing to watch! She is so entirely herself, filled with emotion and humour. Highly recommend going to see her if shes ever in town. 

Emily performed at Auckland's Silos as part of the Auckland Arts Festival.

item.title: A Day With James
item.content:encoded:
Words by Eliza Graham and Imagery by Madeleine Brighouse

James’ approach to our ‘interview’ on Saturday was somewhat unorthodox. His receptive manner and cheerful attention became somewhat of an impediment; the day bounced between tomfoolery and productivity. James’ contribution to the occasion brought a wealth of unconventional ideas that lead us down a dark and travelled path that bled into the Wild West. Posed guitars and phony cowboy hats dictated the introduction to our photoshoot. Pertinence? Throughout our stolen time, we gained an earthy and down to earth taste of James’ character.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] James in his lounge having a little jam. [/caption]

It was easy to see that James is assiduous when it comes to focus on his musical craft. All he uses is his laptop and a small interface to record each sound element, which he then smoothly edits together. His resourcefulness may become germane when it comes to his ambition to travel in the future, ideally whilst showcasing his music along the way. His attention to the transitional age period he is currently entering is received as a ripe opportunity. “Without experimentation, a willingness to ask questions and try new things, we shall surely become static, repetitive, moribund” - judicious and relevant words spoken by Anthony Bourdain, who was a chef, author, travel documentarian, and James' big stimulus to travel. The night prior to our interview, the sad news of Bourdain’s death was announced and James injected a thought for the passing of such a personally influential man. He has played a considerable role in his life, shaping and inspiring James' musical development and future prospects.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Front Right is James brother Henry Thorrington [/caption]

James’ attitude reflected his considerate view on life; we shared a lively and frivolous day, speaking of important affairs. When asked if he would rather have fully functioning penis fingers or have a tiny fragment of his body displaced and randomly distributed anywhere in the world (subject to sensation) every time he opened his mouth and spoke, until eventually he ceased to exist as a whole; James preferred the latter. His bold reasoning: “Second one. I would talk on purpose. Because I could either live restricted or live the complete opposite of restricted, and be completely spread out. I wouldn’t look like anything.” Personally I think this is rash; imagine living in a fragmented reality, you are everywhere and you cannot die. That would be scattered hell, but each to their own; James is a confident guy. His music is established, savvy and will make your head swirl in all it’s wavy textures. Pop a listen to his recent debut solo tune ‘Mystery Caller’ and you will notice it’s subtle hooks and progressive signature, a working fuse of classic pop and off-centre funk with modern themes. Though this is only the second song he has released since going solo (previous exposure as part of Yukon Era and Altered Blondes), James' music promises some really interesting and original blends in the future. Stay tuned for more groovy beats from him in the future.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Stolen Girlfriends Club 'New English Tee'. With Rolla's jeans and jacket . [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] We went for a walk and ended up finding these kids who wanted there photos taken too. James in Stolen's  ' The Amplifier Jacket ' and 'New English Tee', with Rolla's denim  and a pair of Le Specs . [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Having a cuppa tea and chat in the kitchen. James is wearing Stolen Girlfriends Club 'Bone Machine tee' [/caption]
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: UMO at Wondergarden
item.content:encoded:
I always feel like I'm invading UMO's space or that I'm watching a private moment.
Ruban Nielson is always so involved in the music that I have found myself wondering if he knows there is a crowd watching and dancing their hearts out to him? I spent much of UMO's performance dancing in the pit, forgetting to take photos, just too caught up in the moment. Everyone was so caught up that we all nearly missed midnight! With only 30 secs to spear, we realised, and the whole crowd/bands/crew everyone shouted out 3, 2, 1 just in time.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: LEISURE at Wondergarden
item.content:encoded:
LEISURE (like their name) are just so chill, they even sound and look it while performing! 
You can't help but bob your head and tape your feet to the heavy base.
Their single "Got It Bad" will always have a special place in my heart.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Chelsea Jade at Wondergarden
item.content:encoded:
I remember seeing Chelsea Jade perform over the years but as 'Watercolours' at events held by Huffer and RUBY, that is when I fell for her sound and her passion. Chelsea's piece 'Life of the party' is on pretty much all my playlists.


A definite high of the festival/embarrassment of the festival was coming off the stage after shooting LEISURE, not noticing where I was going bumping right into Chelsea on side of stage. Oops! 
I'm so looking forward to her coming album, and I can't wait to see where her music will take her!
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Lela Jacobs AW19
item.content:encoded:
Right, I'm done. I don't have to see any more shows this year. I can die happy.
Lela's show was held in the gallery on Krd. Which couldn't be more Lela, her home turf surrounded by people who love her work and what she does!
This collection of Lela's drew elements from the earth and how she impacts the world and how her pieces are all Biodegradable and from the planet, with hair and make-up drawing on those elements too. The make-up was very minimal with the same colour on lips, cheeks and eyes with bright yellow fake lashes on both top and bottom lids. The hair looked as if it had mud and dirt all through it.
It was interesting to see Lela using more colours and coloured patterned but it looked terrific especially combined with giant Worm necklaces (I now want one!). 

"The worker will return to the Earth and the worm will kiss the worker"
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Wynn Hamlyn AW19
item.content:encoded: I always get excited about Wynn Hamlyn's winter collection. Just to see what cool knits have been created. As an avid knitter in my past, I love looking at them and trying to break down in my head how they are made and the stitches. This year was no different. Check out my photos for my favourite knits and other favourite pieces from the collection.

item.content:encoded: Jarrad always knows how to put on a show. Always theatrical and keeps the eyes fixated on the models and garments. From the graph prints to the flowing silk in beautiful blue! I feel quite honoured to say that its been amazing watching Jarrad grow and change and involve into what you see here today! And Its hard to see the earrings the models are wearing, but god damn I want some! They have bits of keys and rhinestones on them!

item.title: Stolen Backstage AW19
item.content:encoded: In amongst the chaos that is often backstage, but at stolen it is surprising ordered. When I arrived, hair was all done (Redken) and finished and the girls were getting there make done (By MAC if you were wondering) and everyone else was just chilling around. The chaos was the all the photographers and videographers who were all trying not to get in anyone's way while still trying to work and get the shot.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Stolen AW19 + Q&A with Marc
item.content:encoded:
Is it possible to do a show bigger and better than the last one? If you're Stolen, then this is your mission.
I had a chat with Marc about the brand and what makes him who he is and what makes Stolen. Plus my favourite looks from the collection. 

1) What is the song that best represents who you are as a human, represents you? What song describes your fears, your hopes, your beliefs, your wishes your dreams, who you are at your core. This question is not what is your favourite song or what song you wish represented you or a song that resonates with you. It's a song that embodies you. (In the past people have struggled with this question and taken a long time to answer, so heads up)

WOW, WITH MY LOVE AND KNOWLEDGE OF MUSIC I CAN’T EVEN ANSWER THIS.  I THINK THE MAIN THING WITH MUSIC AND MUSIC IN THIS MODERN AGE - AND HOW WE LISTEN/CONSUME MUSIC NOW - THERE’S TOO MUCH CHOICE AND IT’S ALMOST IMPOSSIBLE FOR ME TO HAVE ONE SONG THAT EMBODIES ME OR REPRESENTS ME.  IT’S LIKE ASKING SOMEONE WHAT THEIR FAVOURITE SONG IS, OR WHO THEIR FAVOURITE MUSICIAN IS. I HAVE MANY FAVOURITES - THAT I LOVE ON DIFFERENT DAYS. AND SAME FOR THE SONG THAT EMBODIES ME, I’M ALWAYS CHANGING AND GROWING AND SO WITH THAT, THE MUSIC CAN SOMETIMES CHANGE WITH IT.

THE STROKES - LAST NIGHT - ALTHOUGH THE LYRICS OF THE SONG ARE KINDA DEPRESSING, IT’S THE ENERGY OF THE MUSIC IN THIS TRACK THAT SPEAKS TO ME.  IT’S FAST, DRIVING, REBELLIOUS, THE STROKES HELPED FORM MY PERSONAL AESTHETIC TOO AND INSPIRED ME TO START STOLEN GIRLFRIENDS CLUB.

LCD SOUNDSYSTEM - SOMEONE GREAT - REMINDS ME A LOT OF WHEN MY FATHER DIED - AND THAT MOMENT HELPED SHAPE ME IN SOME WAY TOO. THE SONG IS LIKE A NOTE OF KINDNESS, SENT TO SOMEONE AFTER THEY HAVE PASSED, THE LYRICS SPEAK ABOUT HOW THE WEATHER IS STILL NICE AFTER THE PASSING AND THE COFFEE ISN’T EVEN BITTER - AS LIFE GOES ON - EVEN WITHOUT THAT PERSON. IT’S A LITTLE DARK, BUT ITS ALSO HOPEFUL AND IT’S SINCERE.

THE CURE - CLOSE TO ME - OH MY GODDD THIS SONG NEVER AGES AND I HOPE I DON’T AGE TOO!  I HAVE ALWAYS LOVED THIS SONG, ALWAYS REMINDS ME OF CELEBRATIONS AND FUN TIMES - I AM ADDICTED TO HAVING FUN SO THIS SONG IS ME!

2) Would Stolen have the same song to represent it as a brand? or another song?

NO I THINK THE SONGS WOULD BE DIFFERENT.  ALTHOUGH THE BRAND AND MYSELF ARE CLOSELY LINKED, THERE’S A SEPARATION.  THE BRAND IS SO MUCH MORE CONFIDENT THAN I ACTUALLY AM. IT’S REALLY AN EXTENSION OF MY PERSONALITY I WISHED I HAD - MY ALTER-EGO HAHA.I’VE ALWAYS FELT THE SONG BY NEW ORDER - CEREMONY IS SUCH A PERFECT SONG FOR STOLEN GIRLFRIENDS CLUB.  IT WAS ONE OF THE OPENING TRACKS IN A SHOW WE DID BACK IN 2008 AND IT ALWAYS RANG TRUE TO ME.  I DON’T EVEN KNOW MUCH ABOUT THE SONG OR THEY LYRICS - ITS JUST THE TONE, THE MELODY AND THE KEY I GUESS - THEY ALL COME TOGETHER TO MAKE THIS BEAUTIFUL SONG THAT IS ROMANTIC / TOUGH / DARK / HAPPY ALL AT ONCE.  THE BRAND HAS ALL OF THIS.

3) How does this collection differ from past collections?

IT’S STILL GOT OUR HANDWRITING AND IT’S A MISH-MASH OF INFLUENCES/REFERENCES AS USUAL, BUT I REALLY THINK THE SUITING BOUGHT SOMETHING FRESH TO THIS COLLECTION, AND A LITTLE DIFFERENT FOR US - MAYBE A BIT MORE GROWN-UP !  IT STILL FELT SUPER ‘STOLEN’ THO.

4) Is there a pressure with Stolen shows to be bigger and better than previous ones?

YES!!!  SO MUCH PRESSURE THAT SOMETIMES I DON’T WANT TO DO A SHOW BECAUSE I’M SCARED TO FAIL, SCARED TO BETTER THE PREVIOUS YEAR.  I ALWAYS WANT TO IMPROVE WITH WHAT I’M DOING, TO GROW WITH WHAT I KNOW AND WHAT I CAN DO. MY WORST NIGHTMARE IS STAGNATION!

5) What is the music process you go through in picking out your runway soundtrack?

I CONTINUALLY COLLECT MUSIC ALL YEAR ROUND, ALWAYS ADDING TRACKS THAT INTEREST ME TO THIS GIANT FOLDER I KEEP FOR CATWALK SHOWS.  THERE’S LITERALLY HUNDREDS OF TRACKS IN THERE FROM ALL ERAS AND GENRES. THIS COLLECTION WAS LIKE A MIX OF NEW WAVE AND PUNK, SO I FELT LIKE A SLIGHTLY PUNKY SOUNDTRACK WAS DEF NEEDED.  EVERYONE SEEMS TO PUSH ELECTRONIC / DANCE / HIP HOP IN THEIR SHOWS SO IT’S NICE TO TAKE IT SOMEWHERE A BIT MORE GRITTY AND TRY CHALLENGE PEOPLE A BIT MORE. ONCE I’VE ESTABLISHED 20 GOOD TRACKS I’LL HEAD IN TO RED BULLS MUSIC STUDIO (WHICH IS JUST UP THE ROAD FROM OUR OFFICE), I SIT DOWN WITH THE SOUND ENGINEER BEN LAWSON AND WE MOVE THE TRACKS AROUND INTO AN ORDER THAT FEELS RIGHT - THE KEYS HAVE TO LINE UP OR THE BPM HAS TO MATCH, IT’S ALWAYS CHALLENGING TO PUT THIS PUZZLE TOGETHER AND MAKE IT FLOW!

6) I know putting on a show is stressful but is there an element of it that you enjoy?

IT’S SO STRESSFUL!  CAUSE YOU WANT EVERYTHING TO BE PERFECT.  MY FAVOURITE THING ABOUT IT IS HOW EVERYONE COMES TOGETHER.  WE HAVE A BIG TEAM THAT WORKS ON THE SHOW, AN EXTENDED FAMILY I GUESS.  I DON’T EVEN SEE SOME OF THEM FOR A WHOLE YEAR AND THEN THE SHOW ROLLS AROUND AND WE’RE WORKING CLOSELY TOGETHER ALL HOURS OF THE DAY.  IT’S BECAUSE OF THE SHOW THAT BRINGS US ALL TOGETHER AND I REALLY APPRECIATE THAT TIME. GOING THROUGH SOMETHING LIKE A BIG SHOW IS REALLY TAXING AND EMOTIONAL SO IT'S NICE TO WORK WITH GOOD PEOPLE!  YOU LIFT EACH OTHER UP AND YOU WORK TOGETHER TO DO SOMETHING THAT IS BIGGER THAN OURSELVES - THAT'S SO COOL!

7) If everything went to plan and all the opportunities were presented to Stolen where would you want it to go? stores worldwide?

I OFTEN WISH I COULD TAKE THESE SHOWS WE DO TO SOME BIGGER CITIES - ALL THE WORK THAT GOES INTO IT, IT’D BE GREAT TO GET MORE EYES ON IT.  BUT DEF STORES WORLDWIDE IS THE GOAL. WE’RE REALLY STARTING TO CHIP AWAY NOW WE HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON THE BUSINESS SIDE, AND GETTING SSENSE ONBOARD HAS BEEN REALLY GREAT FOR OUR CONFIDENCE TOO - IT’S SHOWN US THE BRAND DOES HAVE INTERNATIONAL APPEAL AND WE CAN KICK IT WITH SOME OF THE BEST BRANDS IN THE WORLD.

8) As an ex-surfer, I've gotta ask when and where was your best ride? and where do you dream about surfing?

IT’S ALWAYS GOTTA BE RAGLAN, IT’S MY HOMETOWN AND ONE OF THE BEST WAVES IN THE WORLD EASY. I’VE BEEN REALLY WANTING TO SURF THE MALDIVES LATELY - I THINK I’M GONNA HAVE TO CROSS THAT OFF MY BUCKET-LIST PRETTY SOON.

9) Can Stolen do some sexy wetsuits?  extra warm for in winter too!

HAHA I WISH!  WE DON’T HAVE THE TECHNOLOGY TO MAKE GREAT WETSUITS.  I’M REAL FUSSY WITH THIS STUFF AND WETSUITS ARE SOOOOO TECHNICAL (IF YOU WANT THEM TO ACTUALLY WORK).

10) So my favourite print from Stolen is the Karl Maughan print, do you find you have a favourite or does it change with each session?

THE KARL MAUGHAN PRINT WAS SUPER ICONIC!  HARD TO TOP REALLY. THAT PRINT HELPED OPEN OUR BRAND TO AN OLDER AND MORE SOPHISTICATED CLIENT TOO WHICH WAS SO COOL. THAT MEETING OF FINE-ART AND REBELLIOUS FASHION WAS A NICE LITTLE JUXTAPOSITION.  I’VE ACTUALLY PERSONALLY ALWAYS LOVED OUR OPIUM POPPY PRINTS WE DID BACK IN RESORT 2012? HANDPAINTED OPIUM POPPIES WITH LITTLE SNAKES WRAPPING AROUND THE STALKS. SO COOL - STILL TO THIS DAY AND SO ROCK & ROLL IF STYLED RIGHT.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Huffer AW19
item.content:encoded:
Huffer turns 21! The same age as me! What better way to have a 21'st than to have a huge gig/party!
Huffer was held at The Powerstation this year and had US rapper Desiigner performing (The guy who did that track 'Panda'). 
Huffer's collection this year was focused heavily on jackets! Epic puffers in a range of beautiful bright colours were mixed in with camos. There must be a camo winter coming, as we have seen a lot of camo prints come through lately...
Another cool thing going for Huffer's collection this year is that $10 from any People Presence product purchased from Huffer stores or online will be donated to the Mental Health Foundation. Let's get the conversation going guys!
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.content:encoded: I always enjoy watching a show come together, watching the make-up artists at work, and the hair stylists create the coolest looks. And backstage at Huffer was no different. The girls had a great look that looked like paint had just been splatted over there lips. Poor things wanted to lick or purse their lips.  The rest of the look was simple and classic. Here are my shots from backstage at Huffer.

item.title: The Beths - Future Me Hates Me Tour
item.content:encoded:
Hey sorry again for getting these picks out late. It is my downfall, letting my editing pile up.

So The Beths the other week, Holy f#ck!

As always they were great! Playing their new album, 'Future Me Hates Me', which I have been playing on repeat a lot lately! Love it!

Some major news for The Beths, they are touring with one of my favourite bands 'Death Cab for Cutie', I am so excited for them! In fact I was jumping up and down when I found out.

I asked some of the band 'The Question', If you don't know the question well here it is:

What is the song that best represents who you are as a human, represents you? What song describes your fears, your hopes, your beliefs, your wishes your dreams, who you are at your core, whether it is one of your own songs or not. This question is not what is your favourite song or what song you wish represented you or a song that resonates with you. It's if you were a song what would it be?

For both Liz (Elizabeth Stokes) & Jon (Jonathan Pearce) decided that what best in-bodies who they are is…

@lizstokedstokes

Drummer for this show was Katie Everingham.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: October - Ultra Red
item.content:encoded:
I pulled friends along the other week to see October headlining her own show at Whammy to celebrate her Album 'Ultra Red'!

Here are my thoughts and photos from the night! And the photos of course, are all very red.

Wellington musician Maxwell Young was the opening act to get the crowd ready for Emma, and that is precisely what he did, the crowd singing every word at the top of there lungs to his song ‘Right here‘. I'm interested to see where he’ll go in life and how his music will evolve. Go cheer him out on Spotify.

October has a place in my heart after standing in the cold with her for hours listening to Cherry Cola! But hey we all looked f#cking cool in the music video. So I was one of the fans who waited patiently for the release of her album. To see what loud grunge, electronic, beast she had created.

Ultra Red makes me want to scream at the top of my lungs and dance around the room! And that's what I do mainly to the song Bruxism.

@octob_r @maxwell_young
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Daffodils at Tuning Fork
item.content:encoded:
I've had the pleasure of seeing Daffodils grow and release music over the past few years and in fact, I been able to get to know them. Which has been a funny delight. But that's another story (A Day with Daffodils, coming soon...)

The gang headlined their very own show at Tuning Fork!

Opening for them was Bene (who is performing at Laneway Festival! So get your tickets) Have you heard her new single 'Soaked'? Go have a listen then!

Daffodils sold out their all age show and man it was packed 400+. It was a fantastic show, everyone singing every line at the top of their lungs. I gave up shooting because all I want to do was dance and sing with everyone else, which I did.

The band was on-cored to play two more songs. My personal favourite of their covers 'Dancing with Myself' and playing their new single 'A Leo Underwater' again due to the demands of the crowd.

@benemusicc @daffodilsarenotforkids

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Bene @benemusicc [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Theo @demonbboy2007 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Jade @angelgrrl2007 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Louis @noinenoine99 [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Isaac @saactingbruv (Soz bro the light was hard to work with from where I was) [/caption]
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: Listener
item.content:encoded:
I have loved and coveted the music which Listener creates, and it means a lot to me. I don't have favourite bands, but Listener is the most important to me.

OK Yeah, I fangirled hard and got all 6 of my vinyl signed. I wore my Listener t-shirt from the last time they performed here in New Zealand about four years ago at Parachute Music Festival. No! I didn't cry during their performance because I'm a stone cold bitch, but I did have the biggest grin on her face.

I often ask people 'The Question' which if you don't know its:

What is the song that best represents who you are as a human, represents you? What song describes your fears, your hopes, your beliefs, your wishes your dreams, who you are at your core, whether it is one of your own songs or not. This question is not what is your favourite song or what song you wish represented you or a song that resonates with you. It's if you were a song what would it be?

Just because I was fangirling didn't mean I was going to give up this opportunity to ask Dan Smith 'The Question.'

His response made me smile because it was another song I knew well and loved.

1997 by the smashing pumpkins.

Listener performs as if no one is in the room, they get so emotionally invested in playing. Lepping around in bare feet and pulling faces at one another and at times looking heartbroken and as they might fall apart.

This performance touched me just as they did fours years ago as a 16-year-old. I didn't take many shots because it would have never been an accurate representation of the show. Instead, I lived in the moment.
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: A Day With Daffodils
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] @daffodilsarenotforkids [/caption]

Eliza and I had the pleasure of spending the day shooting the band ‘Daffodils ’ a few months back. ‘Vixen Vintage Boutique’ from K-Rd were cool enough to lend a few of their clothes for the occasion as well as ‘Creepwear’ from Wellington and Dave Weaver from Stephen Marr contributed his hair-styling skills for the day!

Here are my images accompanied by the famous Eliza’s Words…

Emerging 80’s inspired, quirky pop-synth, new wave, indie alt surf rock band Daffodils is hitting the New Zealand music scene with energy and confidence! The tight four-piece band is composed of Theo on guitar and vocals, Louis on Bass, and BV’s, Isaac on Drums and Jade offering the dreamy synth on keys and BV’s. These guys, albeit young, have been in the game a little while now and have managed to establish a scene of devoted fans already. Here’s my perspective on the operation of the band:

Lyrically prosperous and proficient, Theo has been the content generator since 2012 in the early days of Headroom (a prior band to Daffodils). Roaming Western Springs College layered like an onion back in the day, he has always had a strong presence and has certainly aided the band’s growth into a band that demands to be taken seriously. Theo’s guitar competes with his own vocal timbre in a powerful, notable and somewhat surprising battle for someone of his still budding experience. An ideal front man with an unprecedented, humble appreciation for appreciation; every gig I’m always elated to see how elated Theo is to see how elated the audience is!

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Theo: Shirt and Pants thank to Vixen [/caption]

Isaac means business. He has always shown up to practice well practised and his drumming is a big reason why Daffodil songs have so much spunk. Isaac has been with the band since the beginning and has been a big part in determining Daffodils distinctive, kick-ass sound.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Issac: Dr Martens thank to Vixen [/caption]

Jade’s thoughts are often inscrutable, her collected and reserved attitude gives her a mysterious spark. Ultimately cool, Jade totally helps cement the band’s endearing and slick stage presence.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Jade: Shirt thank to Vixen [/caption]

Laid-back Louis seems to take it all in his lanky typical bass-player stride. With a strong personal interest in music production, Louis brings a range of ideas and emblematic bass grooves to each song, that epitomizes his developing style.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Louis: Jacket thank to Vixen [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Louis: Shirt thanks to Creepwear [/caption]

This assembly of determined, central Auckland kids could have a real shot at getting somewhere in this diverse and open-minded music industry that has proved to have a real taste for their upbeat, progressive and energetically nostalgic sound. Daffodil’s influences include artists such as The Cure, David Bowie and a lot of new-wave and British pop bands. Theo said, “I grew up listening to everyone from the Sex Pistols to Aretha Franklin, and I think that pretty much everything we hear shapes the way we write in one way or another!”  Each member functions on a quirky appreciation for one another and their passion to create really jammable music together. They are currently in the process of recording an EP which will be available on Spotify in the coming months. Listen out for a range of new content with an impressive capture of the dynamics this band can deliver. Daffodils have a savvy foot in the door, keep an ear on them...

Eliza Graham.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2500.0"] Theo: Shirt thank to Vixen [/caption]
item.dc:creator: maddiebrighouse@hotmail.com

item.title: The Chills - Snow Bound

The Chills came up from their secret location somewhere down in the south island to play for us at Galatos last Saturday.

Opening for them was the beautiful Tiny Ruins (Hollie Fullbrook), who I have adored since her release of the album 'Brightly Painted One' and as always was so dreamy to watch and listen too.

I gotta say it was a little sad to see that I (and two mates) were some of the youngest, there were not many people our age (early 20's).

Its algood if you couldn't make it to see them cos that's what I'm for, to bring you photos of these kiwi legends!

Go hit them up if you get the chance to see them live! Their new album 'Snow Bound' which they performed is on point! My favourite track has gotta be 'Bad Sugar'.

item.title: The Jungle Giants
item.content:encoded:
Being. is a fantastic artist who I've seen play and even photographed all around Auckland. Looking forward to seeing her perform again in two weeks or so with Same Name Confusion on the Garrett St rooftop.

This was my first time hearing and seeing The Leers. I can see why they opened for The Jungle Giants with their happy bounce vibe.

The Jungle Giants have been my go-to artist for beats, to uplift or to sing loudly in the car and for dancing around the house too. The Jungle Giants are up there with my favourite bands to see live. I saw The Jungle Giants the first time they flew over to see us at the REC Bar and now to see them pull a crowd four times the size at the studio on Krd in such a short time makes me so excited for them and where they will go!
